newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore share index slips early, demand subdued.
newsitem.headline: Singapore share index slips early, demand subdued.

text.p: Singapore's Straits Times Industrials Index (STII) slipped in early Friday trade with institutional demand low and investor sentiment cautious.
Dealers said many core stocks weakened under profit taking pressure but smaller capitalisation and Malaysia issues were favoured by retailers.
"It's pretty mixed with the tendency to sell into strength," a dealer with a U.S. brokerage said. Funds, anticipating higher interest rates in the mid-term, would stay wary, he added.
At 0145 GMT, the STII was down 5.87 points at 2,055.84 with losers beating gainers at 124 to 83.
The SES Property Index was a shade firmer, up 3.59 points at 687.03, partly aided by bullish bids for land in a recent government tender to build top-end executive condominiums.
Leading the actives was Aztech Systems, where a block trade of 10 million shares changed hands at Singapore $0.56. It rose to S$0.59, up S$0.025 on a volume of 11.1 million shares.
Losers included MBF Capital, down on profit taking after Thursday's speculative gains to S$2.89 down S$0.11.
OCBC Foreign eased to S$17.90 down S$0.10 and Cycle & Carriage fell to S$14.60 down S$0.10.
